paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Limnophora mesolissa Bezzi, 1928: 175
. Lectotype male, Taviuni, Fiji in BMNH, des.
Pont (1970a: 420)
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Small species, body length 2.4–4.5 mm; male frons broad, about one-third of head-width; frontal triangle shining black; arista subplumose; halteres yellow; 4 postsutural dorsocentral setae; scutum dark brown, sometimes, especially in female, with a narrow silver band in front of the suture, interrupted in middle, and another one in front of the scutellum, more developed in female; abdomen dark brown, grey dusted, abdominal tergites 3 and 4 with two broad lateral triangular marks.

Material examined.

Distribution. American Samoa , Australia (NT, Qld), Belau , Bellona I., Fiji , French Polynesia (Society Is), Guam , Indonesia ( Maluku ), Lord Howe I., Micronesia , New Caledonia ( New Caledonia ), Northern Marianas, PNG (Bismarck Arch, PNG ), Rennell I., Solomon Is, Tonga , Vanuatu , Western Samoa .
